instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Hello Team,

I have an issue with a macbook air A1466 (MB: 820-00165-A).

When I "plug" the magsafe, I have a green light for a second (maybe less) and then nothing more after it, the battery doesn't charge.
Strangely, it's working absolutely well when I use it only on battery.

Here are the tests / changes I made:
- Used a different magsafe (known working)
- I changed the I/O board with a new one
- I changed the I/O board cable with a new one
- During one second (after "pluging" the magsafe) I have +/- 3.4v on PPBUG G3H and 0V after it (measured at L7095)

But nothing solved the issue.

I'm not sure where to start tshoot.
Can you help me with this please ?

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Looks like leakage on input stage.
Did you test with 45/60W original Magsafe 2 charger?
If yes, see what happens with fake charger, or lab PSU.

Post exact ohm value for R7012 (measured onboard).
Check if D7012 is good and post U7010 voltages.

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Hello 2informaticos[B],[/B]

thank you for taking care of my request (and the welcoming of course).

[I][U]1. Did you test with 45/60W original Magsafe 2 charger?[/U][/I]
Yes, with both of them and the result is exactly the same (green light for one second and nothing after it)

[I][U]2. If yes, see what happens with fake charger, or lab PSU. [/U][/I]
I've just check with a fake 60W magsafe 2 charger (I never use it) and the green light appeared then the orange light with the battery charging.

[I][U]3. Post exact ohm value for R7012 (measured onboard).[/U] [/I]
The exact value of R7012 is 68,2 kOhm

[I][U]4. Check if D7012 is good[/U][/I]
The D7012 (Diode Zener) seems to be good (0,807 V on normal flow and infinite on the opposite flow)

[I][U]5. P[I][U]ost U7010 voltages[/U][/I][/U][/I]
I'm sorry, but I don't find the component U7010 on schematics, where can I find it ?

I remain at your entire disposal.
Thanking you in advance

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Sorry by mistyping; read Q7010 instead.

Very likely bad Q7180...

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
[I][U]5. P[I][U]ost Q7010 voltages[/U][/I][/U][/I]

Ok so, with the fake 60W magsafe 2 charger I have:

[I]1 = 16,66 V
2 = 16,66 V
3 = 16.66 V
4 = 6,74 V
5 = [I]16.66 V[/I]
6 = [I]16.66 V[/I]
7 = [I]16.66 V[/I]
8 = [I]16.66 V[/I][/I]

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
I expected voltages with original charger connected.

If board works with fake charger, change Q7180.

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Ok, sorry

[I][U]5. P[I][U]ost Q7010 voltages[/U][/I][/U][/I]

Ok so, with the official 60W magsafe 2 charger I have:

[I]1 = 135 mV (unstable)
2 = 86,6 mV (unstable)
3 = 79,9 mV (unstable)
4 = 6,74 V
5 = 7,31 V
6 = 49,4 mV
7 = 49,4 mV
8 = 7,31 V

[U]6. If board works with fake charger, change Q7180.[/U][/I]
Ok, I'll change Q7180, and give you a feedback after it.

threads.title: 820-00163-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Quick update:

After replacing Q7180 the battery now charge and work normally with an official magsafe 2 charger.

Thank you very much for your experience sharing and response time.
As always, your reputation precedes you.
